intro: Dialium unifoliolatum subsp. septentrionale, commonly known as the northern African satinash, is a deciduous tree native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its simple, elliptical leaves that are often clustered at the base of the stems. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by edible, fleshy fruits. It is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils.
